[[Maglor]] (foster father) | siblings=[[Elrond]] (twin brother) | spouse= | children=[[Vardamir]], [[Tindómiel]], [[Manwendil]], and [[Atanalcar]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons=[[Aranrúth]] | steed= }} '''Elros''' was the son of [[Eärendil]], the great hero of the [[First Age]], and his wife [[Elwing]]. He was the twin brother of [[Elrond]] and both were [[Half-elven]].{{S|Earendil}} Choosing to live as a mortal [[Men|Man]], he became a lord of the [[Edain]] and the first [[King of Númenor]], taking the royal name '''Tar-Minyatur'''. ==History== === Life in Beleriand === Elros and Elrond were born in the [[Mouths of Sirion|Havens of Sirion]] during the darkest days of the First Age, when the forces of [[Morgoth]] controlled most of [[Beleriand]]. When the twins were just six years old, the [[Sons of Fëanor]], bound by their [[Oath of Fëanor|Oath]], assaulted the Havens in the [[Third Kinslaying]] since they desired the [[Silmaril]] on the [[Nauglamír]] held by Elwing. Eärendil was at sea, and Elwing escaped with the Nauglamír and jumped into the sea. [[Maedhros]] and [[Maglor]], the only Sons of Fëanor to survive the assault upon the Havens, took Elros and Elrond as captives and abandoned them in a cave with a fall of water over the entrance instead of killing them.{{L|211}}, answer to Question 4 But Maglor took pity upon Elrond and Elros and rescued them and a mutual love grew between Maglor and the young twins afterwards. Elros was given the name "Elf of the spray" or "star-foam" (see [[#Etymology|Etymology]]), because he was found playing in the water of the waterfall. [[File:Catherine Karina Chmiel - And Maglor took pity upon them.jpg|thumb|left|''And Maglor took pity upon them'' by [[Catherine Karina Chmiel]]]] After the [[War of Wrath]] and the destruction of Beleriand, the Valar gave the twin ''[[Peredhil]]'' the choice over their race and fate. Elros chose the [[Gift of Men]], but still, he was blessed with a life longer than any other mortal Man's. === First King of Númenor === In the first years of the [[Second Age]], the Valar had prepared for the Edain, as a reward for their struggle against Morgoth, a large island in the western part of the [[Great Sea]]. Now by right a lord of the [[Edain]],His father, Eärendil, was a descendant of the Lords of all Three Houses Elros led his people across the sea, guided by the [[Star of Eärendil]] his father, to the island. For this the island was called [[Elenna]] meaning "starwards", and was the closest of mortal lands to the [[Blessed Realm]], though Men were [[Ban of the Valar|forbidden to go]] so far westward that the coasts of Elenna were no longer visible. The Valar also gave the Edain substantially longer lifespans than those of Men remaining in Middle-earth, and Elros and his descendants had the longest lives of all the people.{{S|Akallabeth}} Elros founded the realm of [[Númenor]] and became its first [[King of Númenor|King]] in the year 32 of the Second Age. He took a royal name in [[Quenya]], ''Tar-Minyatur'', thus setting a tradition for the kings of Númenor to take a royal name in Quenya. He brought with him the [[Ring of Barahir]], the [[Dramborleg|Axe of Tuor]], the [[Bow of Bregor|Bow]] of [[Bregor]] and [[Thingol]]'s sword [[Aranrúth]] as family heirlooms.{{UT|3a}}, Note 2 The city of [[Armenelos]], including the [[King's house|tower and the citadel]], were constructed during the reign of Elros. Elros had four children: three sons, [[Vardamir|Vardamir Nólimon]], [[Manwendil]], and [[Atanalcar]]; and one daughter, [[Tindómiel]].{{UT|earlier}}Elros' children [[Tindómiel]], [[Manwendil]] and [[Atanalcar]] are referred to by name only in the family tree "The Earlier Generations of the Line of Elros", which is included in only some editions of ''Unfinished Tales''. === Resignation of life === Elros shared the same physical potentiality of life as Elrond. Since, however, he elected to remain among the kindred of Men, he retained the chief human characteristic of "seeking elsewither" (as the Eldar called it), the desire to depart from [[Arda|the World]].{{NM|P3xi}} He remained unwearied until he was five hundred years old and then laid down his life. Elros's eldest son took up the [[Sceptre of Númenor]] as [[Vardamir|Tar-Vardamir]]. But because Elros had lived so long, Tar-Vardamir was already old, and he immediately surrendered the Sceptre to his own son, [[Tar-Amandil]]. ==Etymology== In a letter from 1958 [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] explained that ''Elros'' is a [[Sindarin]] name that he was given, because he was found playing in the water of a waterfall that fell over the entrance to a cave and that the name is a compound of ''eld>ell'', the Sindarin term for the High-Elven exiles, and ''ros'' based on primitive Elvish ''rossē'' meaning "dew, spray (of fall or fountain)". In an essay that was probably written between 1959 and 1960 J.R.R. Tolkien translated the name as "Star-glitter".{{WJ|Author}}, Note 26, second paragraph about Hadhodrond In an excursus on the names of Finwë's descendants that was written in 1968 or later J.R.R. Tolkien translated the name as "star-foam".{{PM|Finwe}}, paragraph about the names of Elrond and Elros, p. 349{{S|Index}}, entry ''Elros'' The Sindarin elements are ''[[el]]'' ("star") and ''[[ros]]'' ("foam").{{S|Elements}}, entries ''êl'' and ''ros'' In an essay on "The Problem of Ros" that was written in 1969 or later J.R.R. Tolkien considered the possibility that ros was a Bëorian word for "foam" and for the "white crest of waves", but he rejected this idea, because of the Sindarin name Cair Andros.{{PM|Ros}}, p. 369 ==Other names== The [[Quenya]] form of ''Elros'' was '''''Elerossë'''''. After Elros ascended the throne of Númenor he was known by the [[Quenya]] title, '''''Tar-Minyatur''''' in the Scroll of Kings.{{UT|Kings}}, first paragraph Tar-Minyatur means "High first-ruler" in [[Quenya]],{{PM|Finwe}}, paragraph about Itarilde (Idril), p. 348 consisting of ''[[tar]]'' ("high") + ''[[minya]]'' ("first") + ''[[tur]]'' ("master, lord").{{S|Elements}}, entries ''[[minas]]'', ''[[tar|tar-]]'', ''[[tur]]'' All the Kings and [[Ruling Queen of Númenor|Queens]] after Elros also used the prefix ''Tar-'' in their royal titles in the Scroll of Kings.{{UT|Kings}}, first paragraph and I to XXV In early versions of the [[legendarium]], Elros' [[Adûnaic]] name was ''Indilzar'',{{PM|Akallabeth}}, p. 164 which was changed to '''''Gimilzôr'''''. However, in later versions of the Númenórean tale ''[[Ar-Gimilzôr|(Ar-)Gimilzôr]]'' was the name of the twenty-third King of Númenor.{{SD|Drowning}}, pp. 380-1 (§20) ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | TUO |y| IDR | | DIO |y| NIM |TUO=[[Tuor]]
